title: React.createElement(null, null) - should it not throw?
body:
When I do:

```
React.createElement(undefined, null)
```

(this sometimes happens because of a bug in my application)

It just gives a warning:

```
Warning: React.createElement: type should not be null or undefined. It should be a string (for DOM elements) or a ReactClass (for composite components).
```

And only when rendering, it fails with one more warning and an error:

```
Warning: Only functions or strings can be mounted as React components.
react.js:9259
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'toUpperCase' of undefined
    at autoGenerateWrapperClass (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:9259:18)
    at Object.getComponentClassForElement (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:13201:49)
    at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._processProps (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:6615:44)
    at ReactCompositeComponentMixin.mountComponent (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:6313:28)
    at wrapper [as mountComponent] (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:13427:21)
    at Object.ReactReconciler.mountComponent (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:14128:35)
    at Object.__REACT_INSPECTOR_RUNTIME__0_13_1.React.ReactReconciler.mountComponent (<anonymous>:106:41)
    at mountComponentIntoNode (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:12038:32)
    at ReactReconcileTransaction.Mixin.perform (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:16683:20)
    at batchedMountComponentIntoNode (https://facebook.github.io/react/js/react.js:12059:15)
```

This makes bugs harder to debug, because in some cases (e.g. server-side rendering) the warnings can get lost in a log and only the error is visible (saying 'Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'toUpperCase' of undefined'). Why are these warnings not errors then? I suppose that when element type is null, there is not much use of such an element and it's better to throw a meaningful error early.

Also, if the error is thrown earlier, I will get the stacktrace of the function call that actually passed `null` to the constructor. Then I can debug it easier.

I like the fact that you give warnings about stuff, but I think that in some cases errors would be even more helpful.
